results.title: Begonia festival
results.creator_credit: David Corke, State Film Centre of Victoria and Boolari Films
results.brief_description: At the annual Begonia Festival, Ballarat becomes a city of flowers, music, dancing and drama centred on the famous begonia display. Mr. Tom Beaumont, the curator of the glass house in the Botanic Gardens, tends the many blooms. He is a world authority on begonia culture. Highlights of the display are a thousand double blooms and six hundred distinctive single varieties. In the gardens we see a fine display of salvias, gladioli and dahlias. Young and old admire the wonderful colour and variety of the Botanic Gardens and also the open air art exhibition. Commentary by John Morgan.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Corke, State Film Centre of Victoria and Boolari Films

results.title: Begone dull care
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren, Evelyn Lambart and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A lively interpretation of jazz music played by the Oscar Peterson Trio. The music is visually represented in a series of abstract lines and shapes, hand painted directly on to the film, culminating in a fast and furious explosion as the tempo quickens. One of the high points of jazz in cinema (and of McLaren’s career).

results.title: The Back of Beyond
results.creator_credit: Roland Robinson, Janet Heyer, John Heyer and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: Heyer’s romantic impression of life in the inland of Australia featuring the Birdsville Track and its postman, Tom Kruse. Highlights the isolation of the people on outback stations and small towns, and the importance in their lives of the postman and the pedal wireless. Notable in the history of documentary for its strong visuals and use of natural speech, and for being the first production of the Shell Film Unit in Australia. Commentary spoken by Kevin Brennan.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 043. Three Directions in Pop Music
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Peter Weir and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Offers a sample of three trends in recent Australian pop music: the theatrical act of Wendy Saddington and Teardrop; the jug music of the Captain Matchbox Whoopee Band; and the popular rock group Indelible Murtceps.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 037. Country jazz
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, Bob Kingsbury and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The 25th Australian Jazz Convention, 1970, brought 600 musicians and enthusiasts to Dubbo, N.S.W. This annual event startled many of the local inhabitants, especially those who watched the parade of musicians down the main street. Featured artists and groups were the Original Graeme Bell Australian Jazz Band, Allan Stott’s Hottentots, Lachie Thompson’s New Whispering gold Orchestra, Nick Polites and his New Year’s Revllers and the Dubbo Corps Salvation Army Band.

results.title: Anzac: a nation's heritage
results.creator_credit: Lee Robinson, Denys Brown, Don Murray, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A commemoration of the 50th anniversary of the landing by Australian and New Zealand troops on the Gallipoli Peninsula. Highlights include memorial services in Australia, New Zealand and Britain, a re-enactment at Anzac cove and scenes of Gallipoli and Troy today.

results.title: Antarctic Vigil
results.creator_credit: Film Australia and Dept of Interior for the Australian Film Board in association with The Australian National Anatarctic Research Expedition
results.brief_description: An account of research undertaken by Australian scientists at the Antarctic outposts of Macquarie, Kerguelen and Heard Islands. Shows life on these islands including work at the meteorological stations and studies of the unusual animal, bird and plant life found in Arctic regions.

results.title: Along the Sepik
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop, Frank Bagnall, Stanley Hawes, R. Maslyn Williams and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia today”.
Shows the duties and responsibilities of an Australian Patrol Officer in the Upper Sepik River area of New Guinea. With law and order they try to introduce education, health services, agricultural services and a wider political concept. The rugged mountains and diverse native tribes present innumerable problems - most important is to encourage them to live together peacefully.

results.title: An Agricultural Officer in Papua and New Guinea
results.creator_credit: William Shepherd, Maslyn Williams, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Presents the work being done in Papua and New Guinea by the Department of Agriculture to produce better stock and crops, and the opportunities for young men in this field. Various special training and research centres are shown, including the veterinary laboratory, rubber experimental station, cattle breeding station, and extension centres where people are trained as Agricultural Field Assistants.

results.creator_credit_for_label: William Shepherd, Maslyn Williams, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian National Film Board

results.title: The Computer Centre
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir, Joe Scully and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Adults Learning”.
A teaching aid to promote group discussion on the apprehension adults feel in adapting to computer technology. Shows a group of trainees being taught the operation of punch cards as part of a session in the use of computers.
